intro: Sarcolobus cambogensis, commonly known as the Cambogen silverleaf, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible or medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its silvery-blue foliage and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
